{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3219054,"name":"Joel Velez","username":"thomas302","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/c4cdca/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-07-15T20:23:34.703Z","cooked":"

I have a navx-micro installed on a robot over the usb interface. I am trying to use it for field oriented drive control. Running the provided example code the navx never seems to exit the initial calibration stage.

The lights indicate that it should be working. I can flash firmware from laptop, and read sensor data as well using the navxui tool.

Ive read a fair bit of documentation and cant find anything on this issue does anyone have any ideas?

Code used to identify if the navx is connected:

image922×81 10.8 KB

image913×65 11.1 KB

Display on dashboard:

Sample code (lightly modified)
Robot.java (5.3 KB)

My issue seems to be a misunderstanding of how the default constructor worked. Once I specified the Interdace over which I wanted to connect (Port.kUSB) it seemed to fix itself. I could not find this in the documention. If its there I must have missed it.
